content.description: The Frigidaire boulder is the first "good" bloc you encounter at the Creamery. You can't miss it. The boulder's namesake problem starts dead-center of the main face. Grab a super-sharp sidepull with your left hand, and a pistol-grip crimpy thingy with your right. Pull off the ground and try to deadpoint a pocket (hard), then climb through some crimps, and, right at the tippy top, power through the crux.
content.protection: Multiple pads, ideally. And a competent spotter.
content.location: First boulder off the main trail (there are other boulder you walk by on the way in, but they are on the trashy side).

content.description: Nice problem that demands good footwork and core tension. Start standing with right hand in pocket and left hand on crimp rail. Several satisfying deadpoints to sloping crimps lead to an easy and airy slab.
content.location: On the Frigidaire boulder, around the corner to the left of Frigidaire. Basically, the North face of the boulder.

content.description:
Fantastic warmup, with comfy holds and tall topout. A must-do! The start might have to be a little bit of a "hop" for some people, but sometimes (in my opinion) hop-starts are more fun that static-starts. Oh, and If you want the HOLY GRAIL OF FUN, then you should start on the little boulder about 4 feet from the base and leap to the starting jug.

However you start, climb line of big holds to glory.
content.protection: Pads and spotter. Landing is okay, but there's some uninviting bushes behind you as well. Tread carefullyÂ—this is a tall one.
content.location: On the Frigidaire boulder (first good boulder you come to). Immediately right of Frigidaire. Look for buckets.
